message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.NE. 

The paper proposes a machine learning framework for solving combinatorial optimization problems on graphs, which falls under the scope of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The framework uses reinforcement learning and deep neural networks, which are common techniques in machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also discusses the use of graph neural networks, which are a specific type of neural network designed for graph data (cs.DS). The problems being solved are NP-hard, which is a subfield of theoretical computer science (cs.DM). Finally, the paper proposes a novel learning strategy based on AlphaGo Zero, which is a deep reinforcement learning algorithm, falling under the scope of neural networks (cs.NE).
